description: A special that comes with the Fourth Stage DVD-BOX. It is comprised of a recap from First Stage to Third Stage, along with staff commentary and sneak preview of the making of the Fourth Stage.
synonyms: Initial D: Project D to the Next Stage - Speculations on Project D

title.native: 頭文字〈イニシャル〉D SECOND STAGE
頭文字〈イニシャル〉D THIRD STAGE

alternative: Ryou Takashi (リョウ・タカハシ)

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Sunma47) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/三間雅文)

One of the industry's most prolific sound directors, having worked on more than 300 productions.

After having graduated college, Mima joined Magic Capsule, a sound production company ran by his relative [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062/). In 1986, he debuted as a sound director on [MD Geist](https://anilist.co/anime/1285/MD-Geist/). He left Magic Capsule in 1996, and later joined Techno Sound. In 2004, he became the studio's representative director.

Shuichi Shigeno is a Japanese manga artist famous for creating Initial D. Shigeno has also created Baribari Densetsu, Dopkan, and Tunnel Nuketara Sky Blue all prior to the manga that would make him famous in 1995. In 1985, he received the Kodansha Manga Award in shounen for Bari Bari Densetsu.

He owns a 1980s Toyota Sprinter Trueno with a panda white color scheme, like Initial D's main character Takumi. He also owns a Sonic Blue Mica-colored 1999 WRX Type STi Version 6 with an STi sports bumper (a part from the STi sport catalogue made to look like the 22B STi bumper but fits non-wide body Imprezas) just like Takumi's father, Bunta. One of his notable students is Jyoji Morikawa, creator of Hajime no Ippo.

Dave Rodgers is an Italian songwriter, composer, and producer.

Dave Rodgers, considered by many as the "father of Eurobeat", wrote and produced over 2500 songs for many famous artists, like the J-POP singer [Namie Amuro](https://anilist.co/staff/101167/Namie-Amuro) ( Try Me, Watashi Shinjite), [V6](https://anilist.co/staff/168540/V6) ( Ultraman Tiga, Take me higher), [Max](https://anilist.co/staff/285959/MAX) and many others.

A handful of these songs are used in the Initial D anime and video games. He's also apart of the Eurobeat group [The Spiders From Mars](https://anilist.co/staff/277077/The-Spiders-From-Mars). He was married to [Alessandra Mirka Gatti](https://anilist.co/staff/321715) with whom he had one son, [Federico Pasquini](https://anilist.co/staff/321713).
He is a scriptwriter and novelist.

edges.role: Insert Song Performance ("Get Ready For Loving")

node.description:
Gian Luca Anceschi, or more known as Luca Anceschi, is an Italian vocalist and producer.

He started his career in 1993, singing in several rock, metal and hard rock bands, being the most known the band "Libra". That same year he successfully dedicated himself to various productions of the HI-NRG and Dance genre.

From 1995 to 1997 he worked with [Giancarlo Pasquini](https://anilist.co/staff/126216/Dave-Rodgers) at A-Beat-C under the Black Power alias. After that, he worked as a soloist singer until now days. But in 2002 he made three songs under the High Level alias at Time Records.

edges.role: Insert Song Performance ("Dancin' In My Dreams")

node.description: **Fabio Tordiglione**, known professionally as **Fabio Lione**, is an Italian singer and lyricist who has worked with many bands in the metal genre. He was known for being the singer of Italian power metal band Rhapsody of Fire for 21 years. He later formed his own band Turilli / Lione Rhapsody with former Rhapsody of Fire guitarist Luca Turilli. He is also the current lead vocalist of Angra, and was the original singer of Labyrinth and Vision Divine. He was previously an Eurobeat artist going under the alias J.Storm
**Claudio Magnani** is an Italian vocalist and songwriter who has worked for several labels.
**Claudio Magnani** is an Italian vocalist and songwriter who has worked for several labels.

node.description:
Davide Di Marcantonio is an Italian Eurobeat artist.

He is the owner of Dima Music, as well as one of the founders of Eurobeat Masters.
